I turned on @StGeorgeBank withdrawal alerts thinking they'd be like Apple Pay notifications. They're not. They arrive days later.
@shanselman @gaz_y2k4 @emilyst the final position in the dock does show a recently used app
@shanselman @emilyst it's rare that I'll bother launching an app from cold
@shanselman @emilyst for me the best interactions are (in order): - actionable notifications - complications - apps launched from dock
@shanselman @emilyst and I agree it's a UX hack, but I think it's aimed at making the most frequent interactions as fast as possible.
@shanselman @emilyst I don't know what the hard limit is. My limit is the number I can bother swiping through, which is low.
@shanselman @emilyst the apps in your Dock should launch faster (or at least appear to)
@shanselman @emilyst it's not an Apple vs Google thing. Third party apps on watch series 1 launch incredibly slowly.

You know that moment when you think the app you're working on just might work and you go to test it on a device?
Processing symbol files...
What ever happened to Android Instant apps?
Filed a radar. https://t.co/5huoZu5Up3
@corduroy yeah, I've seen it with two too.
@corduroy between 7-9 secs in the example I captured with Charles
@corduroy I think it only happens when you resume a suspended app. Doesn't seem to happen for a fresh launch or if the app is in memory.
Only seems to happen when resuming a suspended app that was distributed via Test Flight. Results in a long delay beâ€¦ https://t.co/tAMMJt7aIO
